        public static int byteArrayToInt(byte[] arr,
                                 int start)
        Returns the integer at the start index of the byte array.
        Parameters:
        arr - byte array containing the four bytes of the integer
        start - of the first byte of the integer. must not exceed arr.length - 4
        Returns:
        the integer at the start index

      • byteArrayToFloatArray

        public static float[] byteArrayToFloatArray(byte[] arr,
                                            int n,
                                            int start)
        Converts a (n*4+start)-bytes array to a float array of size n
        Parameters:
        n - number of floats in the array (= size of array result)
        arr - byte array to extract the float array
        start - index of the first float in the byte array
        Returns:
        the array of floats extracted

      • byteArrayToFloatArray

        public static float[] byteArrayToFloatArray(byte[] arr,
                                            int n)
        Converts a (n*4)-bytes array to a float array of size n
        Parameters:
        n - number of floats in the array (= size of array result)
        arr - byte array to extract the float array
        Returns:
        the array of floats extracted

      • floatArrayToByteArray

        public static byte[] floatArrayToByteArray(float[] a)
        Converts a float array to a bytes array
        Parameters:
        a - float array to be converted to a byte array
        Returns:
        a byte array containing all floats

      • booleanArrayToByteArray

        public static byte[] booleanArrayToByteArray(boolean[] a)
        Converts a boolean array to a byte array. each byte contains 8 booleans. This means that the size of the byte array is n/8, where n is the number of booleans
        Parameters:
        a - the boolean array to be converted
        Returns:
        a byte array containing all booleans

      • byteArrayToBooleanArray

        public static boolean[] byteArrayToBooleanArray(byte[] a)
        Converts a byte array to a boolean array. As each byte contains 8 bits, the size of the extracted boolean array is a multiple of 8
        Parameters:
        a - the array of bytes to be converted to booleans
        Returns:
        the array of booleans extracted from the byte array

      • byteArrayToChar

        public static char byteArrayToChar(byte[] arr,
                                   int start)
        Returns the char at the start index of the byte array.
        Parameters:
        arr - byte array containing the 2 bytes of the char
        start - of the first index of the char. must not exceed arr.length - 2
        Returns:
        the char at the start index
